Seimith's Portfolio

Hola, my name is Seimith (sā · miTH) and I'm a Front-End Web Developer! What's goin' on?

  • Blog
  • LinkedIn
  • Resume

One of the first things I did when I got my first computer in 2000 was get an account at Neopets.com and learn HTML and CSS. Over the course of a few years I lost sight of my passion and began to follow the prospects of big money and majored in Financial Mathematics in college. I held a plethora of Finance and Accounting internships while working full-time during those four years of hell. When I finally graduated I realized that I made an unsatisfying choice and wanted to pursue a career that would give me intrinsic happiness. I wanted to do something that was mentally stimulating and something that was magical. I snagged up a job right after college, saved a few quarters and lint in my pocket, and moved from Boston to San Francisco in September '13 to pursue Web Development.

SentiVestor

"SentiVestor" was create with Behavioral Economics/Finance in mind. Search for a stock symbol, get recent tweets on it, and see the sentiment analysis of the tweets.

The Twitter API, SentiGem API, Yahoo Finance, and Kickchart.JS were used.

Mock Email: demo@demo.com
Mock Password: demo

Chartify.Me

"Chartify.Me" is an application that allows you to chart your Facebook Stats. If your friends are linked with this app, you can compare your stats to theirs!

The Facebook API/Omniauth, Devise, and Charts.JS were used.

Christian Nelson Alex Sanchez Dana Wright

MoviePop

"MoviePop" is an application that lets you keep track of all of your favorite movies. This app is a single page-app.

The Rotten Tomatoes API, Devise, Bootstrap, and a whole lot of jQuery was used.

Nico Crisafulli

Mock Username: demo
Mock Password: demodemo

ALERTminow

"Alertminow" is a website that allows you to keep track of items that you are searching for on CraigsList. Simply add an item to track and you will receive daily email reminders with CraigsList links in the body of the email. Once you find/obtain your item, all you need to do it remove the item from your tracking list and the email reminders will stop.

Nokogiri, Delayed Jobs, Action Mailer, and Bootstrap were used.

All graphics were created with love via Inkscape.
